H0.text: The brain is where humans interpret seeing, hearing, tasting, and smelling.

H1.text: Spinal cord is where humans interpret seeing, hearing, tasting, and smelling.

H2.text: Receptors are the structures through which humans interpret seeing, hearing, tasting, and smelling.

H3.text: Skin is the organ in which humans interpret seeing, hearing, tasting, and smelling.

A4.text: The brain processes the raw data to extract information about the structure of the environment.

A5.text: Sophisticated purposeful control of behavior based on complex sensory input requires the information-integrating capabilities of a centralized brain.
